text: Since most B cell clones immortalized with EBV virus can be induced to produce <extra_id_0> interleukin-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a typical T cell cytokine , we studied the role of different elements of the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter in such clones by transfection .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation induced <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme produce <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Gene_expression produce <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme interleukin-2 <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: It was found , in particular , that the element TCEd , which binds the transcription factor NF-kB , is very active in all three B clones tested .
This element has no activity in T cells of the Jurkat line .

The NFATd element , which binds the transcription factor <extra_id_0> NFAT-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and is very active in T cells , is only weakly active in one B clone and not at all in another .
Different elements thus contribute to <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter activity in different cells .
